about.title: About Quinta do Mocho
about.description1: Quinta do Mocho is a public housing neighbourhood in Sacav√©m, just outside Lisbon. Built in the 1990s to rehouse families from informal settlements, it is one of many bairros sociais created through Portugal's urban social housing policies. Today, it is home to a vibrant African diaspora community ‚Äî especially families with Cape Verdean, Angolan, and Guinean-Portuguese heritage.
about.description2: Music, food, art, and strong intergenerational ties are central to daily life here. Despite economic challenges and high youth unemployment, the neighbourhood is full of talent. Musicians, dancers, designers, and athletes from Mocho have gained recognition both nationally and internationally. The potential is here ‚Äî it just needs space to grow.

activities.title: The Community Garden
activities.description: Together with the local association Mocho+, residents of Quinta do Mocho, Hortas Comunit√°rias, and the Logos Circle Lisbon, we are building an urban community garden. The garden will grow vegetables, herbs, and edible plants; teach young people how to grow food; supply fresh ingredients to the community centre kitchen; and create a shared space for learning, collaboration, and pride.

questions.question: What is the Quinta do Mocho Community Garden?
questions.answer: It is a locally led urban agriculture project in Quinta do Mocho, Sacav√©m. The garden will grow vegetables and herbs, provide hands-on education for young people, and supply fresh produce to the community centre kitchen. The goal is long-term sustainability, food education, and community empowerment.

questions.question: How will my donation be used?
questions.answer: All donations go directly to: seeds and starter plants (Goal 1, ‚Ç¨300), gardening tools (Goal 2, ‚Ç¨300), and construction materials including a protective gate (Goal 3, ‚Ç¨250). Funds are managed in coordination with Mocho+ and project partners to ensure they are used exclusively for the garden.

questions.question: How can I verify my donation has arrived?
questions.answer: All cryptocurrency transactions are public and can be verified on the blockchain. We provide explorer links for each wallet address. You can check that your transaction was received, view the current balance, and see the full transaction history. This ensures complete transparency.

questions.question: Can I donate items instead of money?
questions.answer: Yes! We can accept starter plants, seeds, and gardening tools. If you are attending the Volunteer Day on March 9th, feel free to bring items with you. If you cannot attend, contact Amelia on Telegram (@bitzu77) to arrange collection.

questions.question: What happens on the Volunteer Day on March 9th?
questions.answer: On March 9th at 10:00 AM, we will hold the first planting day at the garden. Activities include clearing and preparing the land, building the first garden beds, and planting the first vegetables and herbs. You will work alongside local residents and the Hortas Comunit√°rias team. All are welcome!

questions.question: Who is behind this project?
questions.answer: This is a collaboration between Mocho+ (local community association), residents of Quinta do Mocho, Hortas Comunit√°rias (urban agriculture experts), and the Logos Circle Lisbon. Together we combine local knowledge, community energy, and practical expertise.

questions.question: Can I remain anonymous?
questions.answer: Yes. We do not require any personal information to donate. If you would also like to preserve your on-chain privacy, you may choose to use privacy tools (such as Railgun, Privacy Pools, or similar solutions) before bridging to Base and donating. Anonymity is fully respected.

questions.question: What if I don't have funds on Base or Ethereum?
questions.answer: We have integrated Squid Router for your convenience. It supports various chains and tokens and allows you to swap directly to ETH or USDC on Base or Mainnet. You can also set our donation address as a recipient to avoid any additional transactions.
